method.name: POST
method.doc:
To install one or more available updates, issue an HTTP POST command on the available updates URI.
Use the List the available updates API to discover the update packages which can be installed.
This API will also provide the "type" and "version" fields which should be used in requests to to this API.

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service

param.name: updates
param.doc: The list of available updates to install

param.name: type
param.doc: The type of update package to install (For example, "firmware", "ipm")

param.name: version
param.doc: The version of the update package to install (For example, "9.0.6.0", "3808.28174")

response.doc: This response may be returned if the "type" and "version" fields were not present in the request.
This response may also be returned if the update operation is invalid for the current platform. For example, "firmware" updates can not be installed on Docker deployments.
The provided "type" and "version" could not be resolved to an available update. Use the List the available updates API to discover valid values for these fields.
The package installation mechanism failed. If the file was uploaded using the Upload an update package API, ensure that the file checksum is correct.
